author: T
content: Bullish: This DOJ suit may arguably be the best example of government failure and overreach in an economy. Hopefully this all blows over, otherwise the US govt will have successfully destroyed one of America’s greatest innovations ever.

author: Orlando
content: At $180, Alphabet is like buying Amazon in 2010. Short-term thinkers can sell; I’m here for the compounding returns over the next decade.

author: Bren
content: Bullish: When Pichai congratulating Trump on phone with Musk there in the room, makes the news on cnbc, you know that's a cheap shot from cnbc. Like Morgan Stanley's High Alpha pick.....Google all the way. ho ho ho!

author: Guadalupe
content: Not loving the margin trends. All this AI spending is weighing down profitability. They need to start showing ROI soon or risk losing investor confidence.

author: Kojo Mojo
content: When this trash will ever go up

author: Sierra
content: For a company with $80B in quarterly revenue, growing at 16% is insane. But why does Wall Street focus on what they missed instead? 🤦‍♂️

author: Timothy
content: AI wars are just heating up. If anyone can outspend and outinnovate competitors, it’s Google. Holding through the noise

author: Nicole
content: How does Google survive if their search dominance gets clipped by regulators? Losing Chrome would sting badly. Too risky for me.

author: Hannah
content: Every time Google is hit with antitrust news, the stock rallies later. Classic overreaction setup. Buy the dip, hold for years.

author: Gustavo
content: Say what you want about the DOJ case, but Google Search is still printing cash. The moat is huge, and AI just makes it deeper.

author: VinceL
content: Bullish: It's clear GOOGL going up. All this doj news is noise. Not going to happen.
